Dating: NAQADA II (not before); NAQADA; NAQADA III (not after)
Name: Palette
Description: This make-up palette in schist dating from the period of Naqada II-III takes the form of two antelopes, the legs tied. The anatomy of the animal is marked by several details: one notices the horns, the eyes, the mouth, several folds in the stomach and the hooves. Under the eyes of each antelope, a hole for suspension has been pierced.
